title: How to Make Edible Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough

steps.headline: Combine the butter, brown sugar, vanilla, and salt.
steps.description: In a large bowl pour the softened butter, brown sugar, vanilla extract, and salt. Use a spatula or mixer to combine them thoroughly.

steps.headline: Pour the one tablespoon of milk in and stir again.
steps.description: Then add the flour, only adding one tablespoon at a time, while mixing properly. Combine the ingredients until there are no flour streaks and the ingredients start to form a dough.

steps.headline: Add the chocolate chips.
steps.description: Use the rubber spatula to mix well.

steps.headline: Serve and enjoy!
steps.description: Eat the cookie dough right out of the bowl or add it on your favorite desserts, such as ice cream, cake, and/or brownies.

steps.headline: Cream the butter and brown sugar.
steps.description: In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and brown sugar on high for about two minutes using a hand or electric blender. Cream until the butter is light, fluffy, and brown.

steps.headline: Pour in the vanilla extract and salt to the creamed butter.
steps.description: Blend again for about thirty seconds until properly combined.

steps.headline: Pour in the flour to the cookie dough and blend again.
steps.description: The cookie dough will start to become crumbly and dry. Blend on slow speed until there are no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Pour in the milk.
steps.description: Blend again until the cookie dough forms and is slightly sticky.

steps.headline: Add the chocolate chips.
steps.description: Blend on slow speed, mixing until the chocolate chips combine in with the cookie dough.

steps.headline: Serve and enjoy!
steps.description: Eat the cookie dough right out of the bowl or add it to your favorite desserts such as ice cream, cake, and/or brownies.
